meanings.definition: Existing or occurring at the same time
meanings.sent1: The coenduring colors of the sunset painted the sky in harmony.
meanings.sent2: The coenduring friendship between the two children was evident to everyone.
meanings.sent3: The coenduring laughter of the twins filled the room with joy.
meanings.sent4: The coenduring bond between the siblings was unbreakable.
meanings.sent5: The coenduring beauty of the ancient ruins captivated all who visited.

meanings.definition: To endure together or at the same time
meanings.sent1: The team coenduring the challenges emerged stronger and more united.
meanings.sent2: We coendured the storm together, finding strength in each other's presence.
meanings.sent3: The siblings coenduring the long road trip entertained themselves with silly games.
meanings.sent4: Their love coendured the test of time, remaining steadfast through all trials.
meanings.sent5: The old tree coendured many seasons, standing tall and proud in the forest.
